results.title: Fried green tomatoes at the Whistle Stop Cafe (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Jordan Kerner, Jon Avnet, Fried Green Tomatoes Productions, Electric Shadow Productions, ACT III Communications and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: Dowdy housewife Evelyn Cooch meets an elderly lady, Ninny Threadgoode, who transports Evelyn back to the 1930’s by weaving a magical tale about two women, gentle Ruth, and headstrong Idgie, who ran the Whistle Stop Cafe during the Depression. Idgie’s and Ruth’s friendship defied all odds, and remained strong even when the scandal of murder threatened to separate them. Academy Award winners Jessica Tandy and Kathy Bates play Ninny and Evelyn, while Mary-Louise Parker and Mary Stuart Masterton give excellent performances as the friends Ruth and Idgie. Based upon the novel by Fannie Flagg who also wrote the screenplay.

results.brief_description: A passionate interpretation of Emily Bronte’s classic Victorian novel starring Laurence Olivier, Merle Oberon, David Niven, Donald Crisp, Flora Robson and Geraldine Fitzgerald.

results.title: High noon (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Fred Zimmerman, Stanley Kramer and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: A retired marshall is forced to take up his badge and guns again when a killer he has sent to jail returns to town seeking revenge. The townspeople refuse to help and his new bride wants him to run away from the fight. The marshall meets the killer and his three accomplices at high noon in one of the most suspenseful and thrilling gunfights ever filmed. Cast includes Gary Cooper and Grace Kelly. Based on the story ‘The Tin star’ by John W. Cunningham.

results.title: Too beautiful for you = Trop belle pour toi
results.creator_credit: Bertrand Blier, TFI Films, SEDIF and Orly Films
results.brief_description: Gerard Depardieu, Josiane Balasko and Carole Boquet feature in this romantic menage. Depardieu is a car salesman whose heart is touched by his secretary who is the very antithesis of his beautiful and poised wife. Her presence does more than disturb his equilibrium; it exposes a need to find the genuine love and affection his life has hitherto lacked. Depardieu brings his vast and versatile talent to the role of Bernard, an ordinary man. Josaine Balasko is superb as the secretary Colette and touches the heart, while Carole Bouqet, as the beautiful but empty wife Florence must learn to accept that beauty is not enough.

results.title: High spirits
results.creator_credit: Neil Jordan, David Saunders, Stephen Woolley, Palace Pictures and Vision pdg
results.brief_description: A desperate Peter Plunkett (Peter O’Toole) endeavours to save his crumbling Irish ancestral castle threatened with foreclosure by turning it into a hotel with a difference. Peter and his loyal staff create a supernatural fantasy to lure American tourists. All hell breaks loose when Jack (Steve Guttenberg), a married American, falls in love with Mary (Daryl Hannah), a gorgeous ghost. This prompts the real ghosts of Plunkett castle to wreak havoc. An hilarious, ghoulish, supernatural farce with collapsing sets and wind machine action. Cast members complained that the producers crudely altered the original whimsical intentions of writer-director Neil Jordan. Cast includes Beverley D’Angelo, Liam Neeson, Peter Gallagher, Jennifer Tilly, Ray McAnally, Martin Ferrero, Donal McCann, Connie Booth, Liz Smith and Mary Coughlan.

results.title: Thumbelina
results.creator_credit: Gary Goldman, Don Bluth, John Pomeroy and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Hans Christian Andersen’s classic fairy tale tells the story of a tiny girl called Thumbelina. One magical night she meets Prince Cornelius, an enchanted fairy as tiny as herself, and she is sure she has found true love. Before their romance can blossom, she is kidnapped by a show business family of toads, waylaid by a scheming beetle and betrothed to a befuddled mole. Thumbelina’s journey home is fraught with adventure, but at last she comes to believe that if she follows her heart, nothing is impossible. Music by Barry Manilow. Features the voices of Jodie Benson, Carole Channing and John Hurt.

results.title: Made for each other
results.creator_credit: John Cromwell, David O. Selznick, Selznick International and ABC International
results.brief_description: James Stewart and Carole Lombard star in this romantic drama which ends happily ever after. John and Jane Mason begin their newly wedded life with a series of problems. John’s mother is angry because Jane does not meet her expectations, and John’s boss places enormous pressures on them. They are forced to live in a tiny apartment with Mrs. Mason and struggle to make ends meet. After their baby arrives, they separate as the strain becomes too much for their marriage. However, the baby’s serious illness draws them together again, heals the breach between them and turns John’s mother and boss into allies.

results.title: The Strange love of Martha Ivers
results.creator_credit: Lewis Milestone, Hal B. Wallis and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Kirk Douglas made his film debut and Barbara Stanwyck starred as the malevolent Martha Ivers in this melodrama cum thriller which engages the viewer until its gripping climax. A strong supporting cast includes Lizabeth Scott, Van Heflin and Judith Anderson. Martha Ivers is a wicked but powerful woman who runs the town of Iverson after inheriting the family fortune. However, Martha has a deadly secret which threatens to ruin her life. As a teenager, Martha was responsible for the murder of her domineering Aunt so she could elope with her lover and the past has a way of catching up her despite her efforts to keep it buried.

results.title: Living free
results.creator_credit: Jack Couffer, Paul Radin, Carl Foreman and Columbia
results.brief_description: The sequel to “Born free” continues the adventures of Joy and George Adamson. Elsa the lioness brings her three cubs out of the wilderness to the couple who raised her. When Elsa suddenly dies, the cubs who cannot fend for themselves, attack domestic animals to survive before disappearing into the wild. The Adamson’s launch a desperate attempt to find the young lions and bring them to the safety of the game reserve. Starring Susan Hampshire and Nigel Davenport.

results.title: How to marry a millionaire
results.creator_credit: Jean Negulesco, Nunnally Johnson and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Marilyn”.
Lauren Bacall, Betty Grable and Marilyn Monroe are three glamorous models on the lookout for a rich man. Pooling their funds, they decide to rent a luxurious Manhattan penthouse in order to lure their catch. Things are not what they appear to be as two of them fall in love with “poor men.” In the attempt to stop each other from marrying the wrong man, the threesome give their best performances. Utimately, it is love and not money which influences their choices. This film is a must see for lovers of Marilyn Monroe’s quirky and individualistic comedy style.
